details.documented_behavior: `quantity` is documented as optional (Required: no) with allowed values 0–10.
details.actual_behavior: `quantity` is a required field (`quantity: number`) and the implementation throws `Error("Invalid quantity")` when `quantity < 1` or `quantity > 5`.

citations.doc: README_backup.md (Parameters table row for quantity): '| quantity | number | no | Number of items (0–10) |' (lines 12)
citations.code: api.ts: 'quantity: number;' in interface CreateOrderInput (lines 3-6) and 'if (input.quantity < 1 || input.quantity > 5) { throw new Error("Invalid quantity"); }' (lines 20-23)

details.fix_summary: Mark `quantity` as required and update allowed range to 1–5; document the thrown error on out-of-range values.

details.actual_behavior: `couponCode` is optional in the implementation (`couponCode?: string`).
